website_summaries.verdict: Cutting-edge technology meets creativity in this large-area tablet featuring on-screen drawing.
pros: High-tech model featuring on-screen drawing on 15.6" IPS display with full HD 1920*1080 resolution
Colors jump, especially at the tablet's 178º viewing angle
True and precise renderings with pen's 8192 level of pressure sensitivity, and pen doesn't require charging
Ultra fast refresh rate of 266 rps provides seamless creative control
Widely compatible with current art software
cons: Minor issues with some tech features
More expensive than other models reviewed here, but larger canvas and on-screen drawing feature

customer_reviews.title: Look somewhere else if you're planning on using Adobe Photoshop or Illustrator
customer_reviews.text: I've had a terrible experience with the XP-Pen tablet 15.6 ever since it arrived. The manufacturers website says it's compatible with Adobe Illustrator cc 18 & Photoshop's latest version, but whenever i try to draw with the pen in Illustrator, it doesn't register the strokes on time. The video above shows what i'm experiencing. My computer meets the system requirements for both adobe and XP- Pen. I've updated all drivers to the latest postings and I've tried going on help forums and for adobe customer care. All the advice i'm receiving lead me nowhere and I'm at my wits end here. I know i wouldn't have experience this issue with Wacom or the more commercially known tablet distributors.
customer_reviews.author: JD1130

customer_reviews.title: Not plug and play as they say.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to receive it and couldn't wait to give it a try. But of course things didn't work out that way. I have a touch screen computer HP but it needed an HDMI plug in. So I was told to purchase a HDMI USB adapter. still didn't work. It also had to be ... so taey say... had to be a 3.0 USB port. Got that but the drivers taht came with taht kept searching for a a different type monitor. So I went and purchased a new computer. Still didn't work! Not so plug and play! So I had to send it back. Back to pencil and paper.
customer_reviews.author: JAP

customer_reviews.title: Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: After watching several reviews I decided to purchase this tablet. After two days of using I eventually returned it due to pen parallax, inaccurate color display, and that I could not adjust the brightness of the screen without the tablet shutting itself off. The screen also gets dirty very quickly. I researched a bit more and decided to go with the Huion brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: Great Graphic Tablet/Monitor For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 months now, couldn't be happier, only regret was having not bought their larger model! I've been using this with Corel Painter and the XP-Pen Artist AC18 stand.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: make sure you have an hdmi to your monitor or computer open and near.
customer_reviews.text: im lucky for my desktop i have chords right where they need to be to have it plugged in and a usb3 and usb2 on top of it. other wise i would only be able to use it on my laptop. you must have 1- usb3 1- usb2 and 1- hdmi inlet for the chord or the hdmi has an apple adapter for something apple like. firewire maybe? anyways it has been great so far but as always buy the warranty i always suggest never know what can happen. im not that great with it and photoshop... but I love it in Krita.
customer_reviews.author: michael williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt even work
customer_reviews.text: My product DOES NOT WORK. my dad just spent $400 on this for me for christmas and He and I are HIGHLY disappointed that it will not work. I've been trying to get this to work for 3 days, I've contacted their support but I'm pretty sure the problem is in the tablet's hardware, I dont think it's a problem on my end. The stylist will NOT activate the cursor, it doesnt do anything. When I install and try to open Pentablet, it says it doesnt detect my tablet. I am beyond angry and dissapointed with this and I better either get a refund or my problems fixed. If my problems get fixed, I will write a new review.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Fluger

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Worked
customer_reviews.text: This was my experience. I bought this as my first professional tablet. I got it and nothing worked on my mac/windows computer. (tested on both PC's) I contacted XP Pen Customer Service and they said it was probably the 3-in-1 Cable so I had 2 sent to me. Both cables caused the screen to go in and out like static TV and the other couldn't even connect. Spending this much money on a product for it not to work should be something to come to mind if you are going to take the chance to buy this. I just don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jace Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.text: It really is perfect for what I wanted. I needed an upgrade from my old wacom intous(no display) which I've had for 3 years. Just drew a quick painting and let me tell you I have so much more control of where my pen slides because i'm looking at my hands. this drawing which would take me at least 2 days to complete with my old tablet took me only a few hours(yeah I know i'm just slow at drawing). Only real problem for me is when ever I change screen rotation 180 degrees because i'm left handed, it doesn't save the settings when i turn it off and on again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really do like the large size of the screen
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to drawing on my Surface so getting used to this is going to be certainly awkward. However, I really do like the large size of the screen, the ease of the setup was painless, the quality seems just as good as a cintiq to me, the extra free items were very nice, and it works with my clip art studio without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Harris

customer_reviews.title: Would not work
customer_reviews.text: This was such a pain to TRY to set up. The drivers on the site are either out of date or don't work correctly with the hardware inside the tablet. No matter what I tried, the tablet refused to be recognized. I installed and reinstalled drivers and the program multiple times and to no avail. The program just said it would not detect the tablet. The tablet was on, but just had a constant no signal. Despite what the other reviews might say, this is not just a 1 step plug in and go. I'm returning it to get a better tablet that is less of a hassle to set up and troubleshoot.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Artist Pro 15.6 for my daughter who is a graphic artist student. Initially it worked well. 1 month later, the connections started to have issues and I had to replace cables. 3 months later the screen stopped duplicating, but it was still able to work from the computer screen. 6 months later, it failed to work at all. I attempted to contact the company and the phone lines no longer are available for customer support and the email I sent was sent back. Don't buy unless you want headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Torbomen

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The pen cannot be accurately calibrated on either my MAC or my two windows machines. It will always be off the stylus no matter what you do. Frequently I lose stylus functionality entirely with the XP-Pen, and the only way to restore it is to restart my machine. (This occurs on two different Windows machines frequently.) If you are looking for a cheaper solution for some basic work, skip this. Its terrible. (Forgot to add, the Stylus came to me busted anyway. The upper click on the stylus has never functioned, even when the stylus actually works with the computer. So I wouldn't trust this Amazon vendor in general, crappy product.) Very angry about the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Z.

customer_reviews.title: nice colors and large
customer_reviews.text: The package had been previously opened and returned but the screen appears to work, mirroring your computer screen but with touch pad capabilities. No software with this item so you will need to choose a drawing program. The larger size is nice two work with, somewhat short cables so you need to be near your computer.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Shiverdecker

customer_reviews.title: A nice tablet but the screen scratches very easily
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tablet but I've been using it for three days now and the screen has scratched quite a lot already, I like the size the case and the tablet, it came fast. The only other thing I would recommend is some kind of stand or something to prop the tablet up a bit, it just helps for me personally when I draw, but thats an easy fix you can buy separately. But I'm not super happy about the screen scraping so soon.
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: VERY UPSET AT XP PEN!!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely dissatisfied with this monitor. Came in with a defective cord and pen! The customer service person would not call me to help me figure out what to do. He only wanted to live chat. He kept sending me to different places to the point where I have given up and now I’m 369.00 down with no tablet and deadlines due. I’m extremely upset and hope I can either get this issue fixed or my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Worked for less than 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 16 year old. She used a wacom basic tablet for 4 years. This worked well for less than 2 months. I was hopeful because of the other good reviews I read. It started glitching out an now wont work at all. I'll buy wacom next time. *Update* Replaced the cord and it is working again.
customer_reviews.author: Christie D

customer_reviews.title: Iffy at start, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I really REALLY like this tablet. It's not like the other tablets I've used that sense every single hand wobble making the lines I draw super shaky. Not to mention, I love how it shows what you are drawing on the same screen as you are drawing on. It's especially great for me since I have a hard time with wacom tablets that don't do the same. The hardware did take some time to get used to my laptop, but it's really helpful for artists like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Shulsinger

customer_reviews.title: Works great I couldn't be happier with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Works great I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I am using this device to a computer to a projector at about 86in. I use Adobe Photoshop illustration with it all day and I am very happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful quality
customer_reviews.text: My son attends a high school for visual artists and designers. He loves this tablet and insists he will be able to use it beyond school.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Wacom results without the Wacom price tag.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, super easy to set up, love the fact that came with a whole bunch of accessories. Better than what I expected and for a much better price, in comparison to the Wacom tablets.
customer_reviews.author: EasyBreezy

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first tablet that also included a screen. I'm an illustration major in college, and this is excellent for my digital drawing class. As with any tablet, it takes some getting used to. Some controls are confusing at first, and you may have to mess around with the settings so that it cooperates to your liking. Overall, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lilyclark

customer_reviews.title: Nice, good size, and great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Portable but big to carry around.. I loooove it though! Screen quality isn’t bad but only downside the cursor is a little off when writing not sure why? I looked at a bunch of ways to fix it but cant seem to. But it’s just slightly off otherwise good.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Harris

customer_reviews.title: Good Moderate tool
customer_reviews.text: Good as a mid-level tool, but did not provide the shading and variable pen size and shape that I expected.
customer_reviews.author: L E Denyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: XP-PEN is severely underrated. This product does what it's set out to do. The only issue I see (and it's a very minor issue) is the pen's nub. It's a little strange and tad-bit sharp, so it will leave streaks across the screen. Nothing Screen Mom can't fix, but I can see it being annoying for some folks.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Draw with ease
customer_reviews.text: Love this drawing tablet, qood quality, not real heavy, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Randal Pettyjohn

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and works well in Gimp.
customer_reviews.text: Great product and works well in Gimp. My only complaint might be the number of cords. It also runs on a MacBook Pro no problem.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right adapter!
customer_reviews.text: Glad I didn’t spend the money on Wacom .. works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Brian P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: came with a broken/detective screen and had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tenshi Sera

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: It's the first time I have a drawing monitor and I have to say that it was actually really easy to set up and so comfortable to use, I don't really have much to say, it's great for me as a designer and ilustrator and I'm enjoying every second that I use the tablet. Thanks you!
customer_reviews.author: Andres Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Good Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and good screen. Is pretty thin and easy to hole. Had some trouble with software but once figured out, it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Miller

customer_reviews.title: Could have been perfect, too many flaws
customer_reviews.text: This product was... disappointing and the service was no better: -Images were blurry and hard to look at -Tablet kept desyncing for hours at a time -scratches too easily -won’t allow me to make it brighter or darker -Poor resizing -Just a massive disappontment
customer_reviews.author: Quill

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Honestly just didn't use it that much and seemed over rated. Just use a pen and paper
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Scratching
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet but the pen scratches this thing like crazy!!
customer_reviews.author: Beca

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works Perfectly! So much nicer being able to draw on a screen for an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: maggey

customer_reviews.title: Very fast learning curve, very intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic! Where a Wacom Intuos takes some getting used to, I was able to pull this thing out of the package and create a medical illustration in under an hour. It is efficient, intuitive, and works great!
customer_reviews.author: B.G. Pennsylvania

customer_reviews.title: No one notified me of a simple problem that could ...
customer_reviews.text: No one notified me of a simple problem that could have been taking care of instantly but cost me about a week and a half in delivery time
customer_reviews.author: Steven Williams

customer_reviews.title: It would have been a keeper had the build been of better quality.
customer_reviews.text: The one I received had a 1 inch diameter area in the center of the screen that would not recognize the drawing pen. I tried calibrating and recalibrating to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: XC4LY3UR

customer_reviews.title: Such a huge size and great action!
customer_reviews.text: What a gorgeous drawing tablet. I bought this because my super old Wacom went out and have been so happy with this tablet. For me, the customized buttons are amazing and helpful. It’s huge, great resolution and color so I can illustrate to my hearts content. Mine works from USB power. I’ve easily used it with Photoshop, Illustrator and storyboarder! So nice. Plus this review is after I’ve had the tablet for about 8ish months and it’s still perfect. I do obsessively wear the glove to protect it from my hand so that might be part of it. Either way, if you want a new drawing tablet, I seriously can’t say enough good things about this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca K

product_meta.title: XP-PEN Artist15.6 Drawing Monitor, 15.6 inch Full HD IPS Graphics Display with 8192 Level Battery Free Pen Stylus for Digital Art Sketch, Paint, Design, Support Windows, Mac OS

CLOSER TO YOUR ART VIBRANTLY
XP-PEN A15.6 graphic drawing monitor tablet provides 15.6 inch large IPS display with Full HD 1920*1080 resolution, features on-sreen drawing for creation art;
The IPS panel display present vibrant color, the 178 degree viewing angle show your art work in the vivid color from wide angle view point;
Full HD resolution at 1920*1080 enables artist to capture every detail in pixel level, allows the artist to get closer to the art vibrantly;

CREATE WITH 8192 MAGIC WAND 8192 levels of passive pen stylus allows artist to drawing line of any weight, simply apply the pressure, easily draw a thick line or retouch photo;
Battery free requires no charging for the pen, maxmize the consistancy during creation; A toggle switch to draw or eraser, increase the efficiency with precision;

UNIVERSAL COMPATIBILITY
The drawing monitor display compatible with most of the popular creative software such as Photoshop, SAI, Painter, Illustrator, Clip Studio, Zbrush, Krita, Gimp, Sketchbook, supports Windows 10/8/7 and Mac OS computer system

EXPRESS KEYS FOR BETTER PRODUCTIVITY
Eergonomic design drawing monitor with 6 fully customizable shortcut keys offer the better portability and productivity;
The brightness adjustment keys are ideal to adjust the brightness that suits you;

Specification
Thickness: 11 mm
DPI: 1920 x 1080
Pen Pressure: 8192 levels
Resolution: 5080 LPI
Visual Angle: 178° 
Display Color Gamut: 75% Adobe RGB
Power Output: 5V DC, 2A (max) 
Power Input: 100 to 240VAC, 50/60Hz

Package Contents
1x Pen display
1x Passive pen
1x 3-in-1 Cable 
1x Pen Stand
1x CD drive
8x Replacement Pen Nibs
2x Drawing Gloves
1x HDMI to Mac Adapter Cable
1x Cleaning Cloth
1x Quick Guide

IPS panel display with 1920*1080 resolution offers vivid color, greater contrast image and sharper display to capture every detail. The 178 degree viewing angle allows you to present the artwork vibrantly from different point of view, ensures the creatives stays real for creation;

8192 level of pressure sensitivity passive pen stylus provides repsonsive and accurate drawing for every width of lines and touch, battery-free feature requires no charging for the pen stylus, 266rps increased refresh rate offers fluidity and natural creativity;

Widely compatible with all sorts of creative softwares such as Photoshop, SAI, Painter, Illustrator, Clip Studio, Zbrush, Krita, Gimp, Sketchbook, supports Windows 10/8/7 and Mac OS computer system, ideal artwork creation tool for artist of every kind;

Slim and portable design with extra 6 express keys, gives you the ergonomic and efficient working experience with better productivity. All in on cord provides the simple and tidy cable mangement when connecting with your computer;
